RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 1 6F Dirt CR: 67. Maiden Special Weight Purse 27100. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: STASSI was slightly unsettled in the gate before the start, prompted the pace from the two path then was coaxed at the top of the stretch, ran down the leader and cleared late. CHAPA was last away from the gate, rushed up to take a clear lead through the turn then was challenged in the final furlong, fought gamely but couldn't fend off the outside challenger. FREYDIS stalked the pace from the two or three path through the turn but lacked the late response to improve position. MISSING A SOCK trailed the field to the turn then move up the rail around the turn but flattened out. BIG SIS NIC was forwardly placed between horses to the half mile marker then fell back and remained back. SECRET WISPER was off the pace on the inside to the half mile marker then dropped back.

ENTRY.NAME: Chapa
ENTRY.COMMENT: last away, rushed up, clear lead, challenged late, gamely

ENTRY.NAME: Stassi
ENTRY.COMMENT: unsettled gate, prompt pace, ran down leader, cleared late

ENTRY.NAME: Secret Wisper
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace 1/2, dropped back,

ENTRY.NAME: Big Sis Nic
ENTRY.COMMENT: forwardly place, between horses, fell back, remained back

ENTRY.NAME: Freydis
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, lacked late response,

ENTRY.NAME: Missing a Sock
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed, rail bid turn, flattened out,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 2 6F Dirt CR: 56. Maiden Claiming Purse 13600. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HARVEY SPECTER was hustled away from the gate to the front to co-lead from the two path to the quarter pole then drew off to prove best. BULLET BREEZE settled at the back down the backstretch then moved out to four wide at the seven sixteenth pole to make a looming bid around the turn but had to move out to six wide in upper stretch and made the late rally to prove second best. SYLVIA I AM was allowed to settle at the back down the backstretch then moved up the rail through the turn but ran into traffic nearing the eighth pole, went between horses nearing the sixteenth pole to make a late gain. BOB'S OUR UNCLE prompted the pace while racing three or four wide and had no late kick. FINE FINE tracked the leaders through the turn then angled out to three wide to move up but faltered. SNIP THE ROSES was off the pace to the three furlong marker and dropped back. GEM DANCER rushed up to co-lead from the inside to the quarter pole and tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Gem Dancer
ENTRY.COMMENT: rushed up, co-led, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Harvey Specter
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled along, co-led, drew off, best

ENTRY.NAME: Sylvia I Am
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, rail bid, traffic 1/8, between 1/16, late gain

ENTRY.NAME: Bullet Breeze
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled back, 4w7/16, 6wupper, rallied

ENTRY.NAME: Fine Fine
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked leaders, 3wupper, faltered

ENTRY.NAME: Snip the Roses
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace 3/8, dropped back,

ENTRY.NAME: Bob's Our Uncle
ENTRY.COMMENT: prompt pace, 3-4wtrip, no late kick

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 3 1 1/16M Turf CR: 89. Allowance Purse 28000. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, OR PENNSYLVANIA BRED. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since July 24 Allowed 2 lbs. Su ch A Race Since June 24 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $16,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) Preference to horses with the most starts at Penn National since May 31st 2022. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the tu rf course, it will be run on the main track at One Mile and One Sixteenth.) (Rail at 14 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SPIRITUAL KING sprinted to the front to an unchallenged lead and set all the pace, won going away. CARLOUN (IRE) was off the pace on the inside, made a bid midway through the final turn but was no match for the winner but proved second best. JO JO KATZ was allowed to settle near the back down the backstretch while saving ground then advanced up the rail around the final turn and in the stretch to be best of the rest. REEL WELL stalked the pace to the middle of the final turn and gave way. BOURBON CURRENCY raced in the middle of the pack around the first turn then was allowed to settle down the backstretch but failed to menace. DEVOTED KITTEN was unhurried around the first turn then moved to contention from three wide to the middle of the final turn but failed to sustain that bid and tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Spiritual King
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace, unchallenged lead, going away

ENTRY.NAME: Carloun (IRE)
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, inside, no match, second best,

ENTRY.NAME: Jo Jo Katz
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, saved ground, rail bid turn, best of rest

ENTRY.NAME: Devoted Kitten
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried, 3wbackstretch, failed to sustain bid, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Bourbon Currency
ENTRY.COMMENT: middle of pack, allowed to settle, no menace

ENTRY.NAME: Reel Well
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, gave way,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 4 1M Dirt CR: 72. Claiming Purse 14400. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since July 24 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, if for $9,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SPINNING MUSICIAN hustled to the front to set all the pace, pulled away going into the final turn to prove best. CITY OF GOD tracked the leader around the first turn the made a three wide bid at the six furlong marker to vie for the lead to the half mile marker and chased the winner home. BENCH PRESS was unhurried around the first turn, steadily advanced down the backstretch while saving ground to the three furlong marker moved out to three wide around the final turn, tipped back inside at the top of the stretch and finished well. FLETCHER STATION chased the leaders around the first turn then steadily advanced down the backstretch but fell back on the final turn, made a rebid into the stretch to improve position. SPELLED WELL vied for the lead from three wide on the first turn then was between horses to the half mile marker and retreated. LUCKY LEWIS was off the pace for the first quarter and was done.

ENTRY.NAME: Bench Press
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried, saved ground, steady advance, finished well

ENTRY.NAME: City of God
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked leader, 3w3/4, vied to 1/2, chased winner home

ENTRY.NAME: Spinning Musician
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace, pulled away, best

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Blackstone Farm LLC, Dr. William Hess & Godolphin LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Fletcher Station
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased, steady advance, fell back, rebid, improved

ENTRY.NAME: Lucky Lewis
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace 1st 1/4, done

ENTRY.NAME: Spelled Well
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied 3w, between horses, retreated

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 5 6F Dirt CR: 83. Allowance Purse 31600. FOR REGISTERED PA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A PA-RESTRICTED RACE(S) OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OR STARTER. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 24 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since June 24 Allo wed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $16,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TUFF CONSTITUTION was rushed up the rail to take the lead through the turn, had a mild challenge in early stretch but dug back in and drew off. MR SANDMAN broke well and chased the top two to the turn then made a three wide bid at the three furlong marker to make a mild challenge at the leader in early stretch but was no match and was clearly second best. TUDOX OPPORTUNITY had no early speed then moved up the rail going into the turn but ran into traffic around the turn, tipped in at the top of the stretch and made a rail bid but was too late. MITROPANOS raced in the middle of the pack down the backstretch then made a mild bid on the turn but failed to menace. SPOOKY ONE had brief foot away from the gate, vied for the lead from the two path to the half mile marker and gave way. GET DOWN BROWN raced in the middle of the pack but was not a threat. GOLDEN TREASURE bobbled leaving the gate and spotted the field several lengths and was distanced.

ENTRY.NAME: Tuff Constitution
ENTRY.OWNER: Pewter Stable and Sardello Racing Stable LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: rush to lead, mild challenge, dug in, drew off,

ENTRY.NAME: Spooky One
ENTRY.COMMENT: brief foot, vied 2p 1/2, gave way,

ENTRY.NAME: Get Down Brown
ENTRY.COMMENT: middle of pack, no threat,

ENTRY.NAME: Mitropanos
ENTRY.COMMENT: middle of pack, mild bid, failed to menace,

ENTRY.NAME: Tudox Opportunity
ENTRY.COMMENT: no speed, traffic turn, rail bid stretch, too late

ENTRY.NAME: Golden Treasure
ENTRY.COMMENT: bobbled start, distanced

ENTRY.NAME: Mr Sandman
ENTRY.OWNER: Club Risque Stable and Quick Gregory K
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke well, chased, bid 3/8, mild challenge, no match

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 6 1M Dirt CR: 71. Claiming Purse 11800. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since July 24 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since June 24 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: INNUENDO went to the front to set all the pace with a clear lead to the seventy yard marker then was engaged by two outside rival and held on. MR BOLDACIOUS was allowed to settle in the middle of the pack down the backstretch then made a three wide bid at the three furlong marker, made a late run at the leader while closing willingly but just missed. BUCK WILD stalked the pace from the inside down the backstretch then moved up the rail on the final turn for a late run, tipped out to the two path and engaged the leader in the final seventy yards but was outfinished. LONG TOM was unhurried down the backstretch, saved ground around the final turn and showed late interest to improve position. PEAKY BLINKERS raced in the middle of the pack down the backstretch then made a mild two wide bid on the final turn but lacked a late response. SUPER REIGN floated out to four or five wide going into the first turn then was allowed to settle down the backstretch but was not a factor. MR. AGRO tracked the leaders to the three furlong marker and weakened.

ENTRY.NAME: Buck Wild
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, rail bid 2nd, late run, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Innuendo
ENTRY.COMMENT: clear lead, set pace, engaged late, held on

ENTRY.NAME: Mr Boldacious
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, middle of pack, 3w3/8, closed willingly,

ENTRY.NAME: Mr. Agro
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked leaders, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Peaky Blinkers
ENTRY.COMMENT: middle of pack, bid 2w2nd turn, lacked late response,

ENTRY.NAME: Super Reign
ENTRY.COMMENT: floated out, allowed to settle, no factor,

ENTRY.NAME: Long Tom
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried, saved ground turn, late interest

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 7 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 72. Claiming Purse 13600. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE MAY 24. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since July 24 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $8,000, if for $ 7,000, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $6,250 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BONITA LASSIE sprinted away from the gate to press the pace from the two path down the backstretch then moved up and took command before the three furlong marker, edged away on the turn and held off the late closing rival to prevail. CAR LADY was allowed to settled down the backstretch then made a three or four wide bid around the final turn and closed well but missed. DANCE A LITTLE JIG saved ground while racing in the middle of the pack down the backstretch then moved up the rail on the final turn, tipped out to three wide at the quarter pole for a late run to be up for the show. MI CLEOPATRA AND I was off the pace while racing three wide around the first turn and down the backstretch then made a bid at the three furlong marker but faltered in the stretch. TEACHER DRAMA was reluctant to load, then hustled away from the gate and cut the corner going into the first turn to take the lead to the three furlong marker and gave way. ALWAJD chased the field from four to six wide throughout and was not a factor. LOVE IS STRONG moved between horses near the seven furlong marker to stalk the pace to the three furlong marker and faded.

ENTRY.NAME: Teacher Drama
ENTRY.COMMENT: reluctant, hustled to lead, gave way,

ENTRY.NAME: Mi Cleopatra and I
ENTRY.OWNER: Bush Racing Stable and Liberty House Racing
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace 3w, bid 3/8, faltered

ENTRY.NAME: Bonita Lassie
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, took command, edged away, held on

ENTRY.NAME: Car Lady
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, 3-4wturn, closed well, missed

ENTRY.NAME: Dance a Little Jig
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground, middle of pack, rail bid, 3w1/4, late run

ENTRY.NAME: Alwajd
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased, 4-6w, no factor,

ENTRY.NAME: Love Is Strong
ENTRY.COMMENT: between 7/8, stalked pace, faded
